page.title: 14DURSTON CHURCH
page.content: St.John the Baptist,the Anglican parish church at Durston,is an old church in the Norman style.For economic reasons the church is now in a group of four churches which share the same vicar.Durston was added to this group in 1978. Durston has a population of approxim_ ately one hundred and twenty. The usual number of people attending church on a Sunday is between twelve and fifteen people. The vicar was sad to report that the church was now kept locked.A pair of brass candlesticks have already been stolen and they wish to protect the eighteenth century church silver.A key is kept in a neighbouring house and the church will be opened on request. This year a preservation order has been put on a chest tomb in the churchyard.
